children.description: Triggers when a new color has been changed.

parameters.name: enable `Boolean` *(optional)*
parameters.description: Whether the widget should be enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`). If not specified, the method will enable the widget.

children.name: color

parameters.name: color `kendo.Color` *(optional)*
parameters.description: The color that should be set as the current value

children.description: Get or set the selected color. If no argument is given, this returns the currently selected color as a [`kendo.Color` object](/api/javascript/color).

children.name: value `String | Color`*(default: null)*
children.description: Get or set the selected color. If no argument is given, this returns the currently selected color as a string in format `#FFFFFF`.If one argument is given, it selects the new color and updates the UI. The argument can be a string in **hex**, **rgb** or **rgba** format, or a [`kendo.Color` object](/api/javascript/color) object.> This method does not trigger the "change" event.

children.name: columns
Example - wrap list of colors on two rows with 3 columns

children.description: The number of columns to display.  When you use the "websafe" palette, this will automatically default to 18.

children.name: palette
children.description: Specifies the color palette to display.It can be a string with comma-separated colors in hex representation, an array of [`kendo.Color` object](/api/javascript/color) objects or of strings that [parseColor](/api/javascript/kendo#parseColor) understands.  As a shortcut, you can pass "basic" to get the simple palette (this is the default) or "websafe" to get the Web-safe palette.
